name: Pongwe Beach Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here the 3rd week of July 2011. We booked a beach front bungalow for our 4 day stay. When we booked our stay the hotel staff indicated all the beachfront bungalows had sun loungers on their outdoor seating areas but, upon our arrival, we found our bungalow did not have the loungers. It was not a big deal for us since the beach was only steps away and staff were more than willing to give us a room with loungers when one became available. However, if it really matters to you make sure you specify this. I think out of the 12 beach front bungalows only one does not have the loungers. Staff were great and I have to give a special shout out to Mo'd. The morning coffee delivered to our room was a very nice touch. The food was very good. We opted for the B&B package and paid for dinner as we went along. Each dinner was excellently prepared and the ingredients fresh. We can not say enough about the friendliness of the staff and the well maintained grounds. It was and excellent stay and we would recommend this hotel to friends and family without any reservations.
reviews.title: Really Enjoyed Our Stay Here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Consistency should be a key factor in any assessment and having been to Pongwe for three years in a row, I can say this property has been consistently...superb! In fact, this year was probably even better than previous years - our two rooms, 9 and 10 have been given a slight facelift and I thought the kitchen was better.
reviews.title: Third time...as good as always

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just an observation, if guests expect Western European or North American levels of "silver" service and conveniences, then I humbly suggest go to an American or Western European resort. However, if one wants a natural and unpretentious piece of paradise, albeit with the odd imperfections and without the modern conveniences, an old fashioned sort of place, then Pongwe is for you.
reviews.title: In love with Pongwe Beach Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We shall be back.
reviews.title: Most Amazing Hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I usually don't write reviews of hotels, even though I travel quite a lot and I use them a lot - but when I left the Pongwe Beach Hotel, I promised myself that I would do it, as they definitely deserve one.
reviews.title: Absolute paradise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Pongwe Beach Hotel for 5 nights in March 2011....and in short, it was pretty awesome.
reviews.title: Pongwe Beach Hotel is as advertised - awesome!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PROS
reviews.title: Thoroughly deserves the No. 1 spot in Zanzibar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - incredible beach
reviews.title: mindbendingly good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: - good range of activities to do at the hotel and off-site (hotel staff were able to arrange it)
reviews.title: The best value for money ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - food was great (lots of selection, and very well prepared)
reviews.title: Absolutely stunning - incredible value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Pongwe with another couple last year and we actually all swore to each other not to tell ANYONE we know about how divine this place was as we didn't want to risk this place being overun by badly behaved tourists and 'ruined' before we all visited again as it was so good... But 8 months on, I simply have to share how good it was, as its just not fair to the incredible team there.
reviews.title: Amazing, just promise you won't tell your friends about it!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our experience was just magical from the moment we arrived until the time we left. The staff were warm and friendly but knew when to give you privacy which is really hard to teach. The rooms were gorgeous yet rustic enough to feel authentic and there were all these special little touches included. My main concern when booking was the no AC however this wasn't any issue as the rooms had the most beautiful breeze from the ocean plus fans. We loved the cute beach bags and sarongs provided for our stay PLUS of course the magical flag for food/drinks service whilst on the beach!! Ohh and the gorgeous Masai warriers (in bright white sandals) protecting our beach, what a place!!
reviews.title: A paradise - we'd definitely recommend staying here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: The staff were incredible, cocktails were divine, the food was amazing (we all ate way too much during our stay), and one night this small percussion band came and performed for all the guests before dinner, wow wow wow. Make sure you splash out and have the seafood platter one night served on a table on the beach, simply stunning!!
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pongwe PLEASE don't get any bigger OR become more modern, you were simply perfect just the way you were. See you soon
reviews.title: This is paradise. Can't say enough good things.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this little paradise in March this year following a safari in Tanzania.
reviews.title: The guidebooks say it is paradise - I couldn't agree more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Pongwe Beach Hotel during our honeymoon on Zanzibar, and it was exactly what you'd want for the perfect honeymoon. Beautiful, secluded, relaxing - and never wanting for anything. Whether we were napping in the hammocks on the beach, wading out on the sandbars during low tide, or watching the sunset from the pool, everything about the place was perfect. There were other people staying there while we were there, obviously, but the only time we ever really noticed them was when everyone was in the restaurant eating dinner. Otherwise, it felt like we had the place to ourselves, most of the time. Above all else, though, I have to say the people there are amazing! My grandfather passed away while we were there, and when we asked if there was phone we could use with our calling card, the woman who owns the place (I hate that I can't remember her name!) immediately offered her cell phone without a second thought and refused to accept any money to reimburse her for the call. Five stars really doesn't do this place justice!
reviews.title: Wish we'd had longer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just got back from the most beautiful place in the world, well we think so. The staff were wonderful, full of friendship and kindness. The sea was warm, the sand was white and the palm trees scattered the beach with shady hammock spots. The food too, was great evey night.
reviews.title: Paradise Found

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Laid back, quiet, food between good and great, stunning location, highly professional low key service ethic, superb tropical climate.
reviews.title: Does exactly what it says on the tin... marvellous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the smily Tanzanian staff, even though they very occasionally slipped up and we then watched lots of on the job coaching for less experienced folks. An interesting and effective staff training ethic that carried its own charm as part of the experience.
reviews.title: Fantastic for our honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The policy of one tip for all at the end of our nine day stay meant the constant expressions of interest in our welfare and 'how are you today' and scurrying off down the beach with a cold beer for me and a cup of tea for the wife felt like they were driven by a genuine interest in our having a good time and proper understanding of the importance of the front line staff delivering on the holel's service promise, not by a short term desire for a couple of bucks tip.
reviews.title: I am not a beach holiday person but I still loved it here

description: Situated on what could perhaps be described as the best beach in Zanzibar, Pongwe Beach Hotel is a tranquil place where one can escape the hustle and bustle of modern day life. It is modestly sized, with ten traditional sea view cottages and has an intimate, personal atmosphere. Set within a secluded bay on the east coast of Zanzibar, Pongwe Beach is a true paradise retreat.
